citeinfo.title: Imperviousness and Forest Canopy: U.S. Geological Survey GAGES-II time series data update

descript.abstract: This dataset consists of three tables with information regarding imperviousness and forest canopy for the conterminous United States sites of the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow II (GAGES-II) dataset. The data include variables regarding percent imperviousness from two different data sources for imperviousness, for the periods 2001-2011 and 1974-2012, respectively, and for both watershed and mainstem riparian forest canopy for 2011.
descript.purpose: These data are intended as support for research efforts using the USGS GAGES-II sites.
descript.supplinf: This dataset is in support of study sites in the GAGES-II dataset (Falcone, 2011) and based on the watershed boundaries published there. Imperviousness from the National Land Cover Dataset (NLCD) is derived primarily from remote sensing sources (Xian and others, 2011), while imperviousness from the NAWQA Wall-to-Wall Anthropogenic Landuse Trends (NWALT) dataset is derived from land use class-based coefficients (Falcone, 2017). The NLCD imperviousness is likely to be more accurate, but is limited to the years 2001-2011, while NWALT-derived values span 1974-2012. See supportive documentation in references. Forest canopy is given only for the year 2011. An NLCD-based forest canopy product exists for the year 2001, but is not compatible with the 2011 data. References: Falcone, J.A., 2011, GAGES-II: Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow, U.S. Geological Survey, digital spatial data set, http://water.usgs.gov/GIS/metadata/usgswrd/XML/gagesII_Sept2011.xml. Falcone, J.A., 2017, Coefficient-based consistent mapping of imperviousness in the conterminous U.S. at 60-m resolution for 1974, 1982, 1992, 2002, and 2012: U.S. Geological Survey data release, https://doi.org/10.5066/F72F7KMG. Homer, C.G., Dewitz, J.A., Yang, L., Jin, S., Danielson, P., Xian, G., Coulston, J., Herold, N.D., Wickham, J.D., and Megown, K., 2015, Completion of the 2011 National Land Cover Database for the conterminous United States-Representing a decade of land cover change information. Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, v. 81, no. 5, p. 345-354. Xian, G., Homer, C., Dewitz, J., Fry, J., Hossain, N., and Wickham, J., 2011, The change of impervious surface area between 2001 and 2006 in the conterminous United States., Photogrammetric Engineering and Remote Sensing, Vol. 77(8): 758-762.

attracc.attraccr: Values were spot checked against source data.

dataqual.logic: No formal logical accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.title: GAGES-II: Geospatial Attributes of Gages for Evaluating Streamflow

srcinfo.srccontr: Sites for which these data provide updated data.
NLCD 2001 dataset from which imperviousness 2001 imperviousness was derived
NLCD 2006 dataset from which imperviousness 2006 imperviousness was derived

citeinfo.title: NLCD 2011 Percent Developed Imperviousness and NLCD 2011 USFS Tree Canopy cartographic

srcinfo.srccitea: NLCD 2011, Xian and others, 2011; Homer and others, 2015
srcinfo.srccontr: NLCD 2011 datasets from which imperviousness 2011 and forest canopy 2011 were derived

citeinfo.title: Coefficient-based consistent mapping of imperviousness in the conterminous U.S. at 60-m resolution for 1974, 1982, 1992, 2002, and 2012

srcinfo.srccontr: NWALT-derived dataset from which imperviousness 1974-2012 were derived

procstep.procdesc: (1) Source data from the NLCD were downloaded (https://www.mrlc.gov/) and converted to grid format in March 2015. The source data for the NLCD are the October 2014 normalized version of data, where all years have been adjusted to agree with one another. The values derived were for 2001, 2006, and 2011.
(2) Source data of imperviousness grids derived from NWALT were based on Falcone (2017). These are values for 1974, 1982, 1992, 2002, and 2012.

(3) Imperviousness and watershed forest canopy are based on GAGES-II watershed boundaries published in Falcone, 2011, using the "run_zonal.aml" script developed by Curtis Price of the U.S. Geological Survey (Curtis Price, written comm., 2007). This tool calculated zonal statistics from raster datasets.

(4) Mainstem riparian forest canopy was calculated by taking the mainstem stream lines published in Falcone, 2011, then buffering them by 100-meters on each side. This created a buffer area from which average values were derived, as in Step 3. Consistent forest canopy only exists for 2011 from the NLCD.

enttyp.enttypl: Attribute Table for imperviousness and forest canopy information, tables imperv_NLCD_2001-2011.txt, imperv_NWALT_1974-2012.txt, forest_canopy_watershed_and_mainstem_riparian_2011.txt
enttyp.enttypd: Data consist of comma-separated text files

attr.attrdefs: Corresponds to unique station identifier in GAGES-II

attr.attrlabl: impervXXXX, where XXXX represents either 2001, 2006, or 2011
attr.attrdef: Percent watershed imperviousness for year XXXX, from NLCD

attr.attrlabl: impervXXXXest, where XXXX represents either 1974, 1982, 1992, 2002, or 2012
attr.attrdef: Percent watershed imperviousness for year XXXX, from NWALT-derived estimates
Percent forest canopy in mainstem 100-meter buffer, for 2011
